020import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;

023import java.lang.reflect.*;
024import java.nio.charset.*;
025import java.util.*;
026import java.util.function.*;
027
028import org.apache.juneau.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;

036/**
037 * Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of {@link JsonParser}.
038 *
039 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
040 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe and is typically discarded after one use.
041 * </ul>
042 *
043 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
044 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JsonBasics">JSON Basics</a>
045
046 * </ul>
047 */
048@SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
049public class JsonParserSession extends ReaderParserSession {
050
051   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
052   // Static
053   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
054
055   private static final AsciiSet decChars = AsciiSet.create().ranges("0-9").build();
056
057   /**
058    * Creates a new builder for this object.
059    *
060    * @param ctx The context creating this session.
061    * @return A new builder.
062    */
063   public static Builder create(JsonParser ctx) {
064      return new Builder(ctx);
065   }
066
067   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
068   // Builder
069   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
070
071   /**
072    * Builder class.
073    */
074   @FluentSetters
075   public static class Builder extends ReaderParserSession.Builder {
076
077      JsonParser ctx;
078
079      /**
080       * Constructor
081       *
082       * @param ctx The context creating this session.
083       */
084      protected Builder(JsonParser ctx) {
085         super(ctx);
086         this.ctx = ctx;
087      }
088
089      @Override
090      public JsonParserSession build() {
091         return new JsonParserSession(this);
092      }
093
094      // <FluentSetters>
095
096      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
097      public <T> Builder apply(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> apply) {
098         super.apply(type, apply);
099         return this;
100      }
101

103      public Builder debug(Boolean value) {
104         super.debug(value);
105         return this;
106      }

110         super.properties(value);
111         return this;
112      }

117         return this;
118      }

122         super.unmodifiable();
123         return this;
124      }

128         super.locale(value);
129         return this;
130      }

134         super.localeDefault(value);

140         super.mediaType(value);
141         return this;
142      }

146         super.mediaTypeDefault(value);

164         super.javaMethod(value);

170         super.outer(value);

201   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
202   // Instance
203   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
204
205   private final JsonParser ctx;
206
207   /**
208    * Constructor.
209    *
210    * @param builder The builder for this object.
211    */
212   protected JsonParserSession(Builder builder) {
213      super(builder);
214      ctx = builder.ctx;
215   }
216
217   /**
218    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace.
219    *
220    * <p>
221    * The definition of whitespace is different for strict vs lax mode.
222    * Strict mode only interprets 0x20 (space), 0x09 (tab), 0x0A (line feed) and 0x0D (carriage return) as whitespace.
223    * Lax mode uses {@link Character#isWhitespace(int)} to make the determination.
224    *
225    * @param cp The codepoint.
226    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace.
227    */
228   protected boolean isWhitespace(int cp) {
229      if (isStrict())
230            return cp <= 0x20 && (cp == 0x09 || cp == 0x0A || cp == 0x0D || cp == 0x20);
231      return Character.isWhitespace(cp);
232   }
233
234   /**
235    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace or '/'.
236    *
237    * @param cp The codepoint.
238    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace or '/'.
239    */
240   protected boolean isCommentOrWhitespace(int cp) {
241      if (cp == '/')
242         return true;
243      if (isStrict())
244         return cp <= 0x20 && (cp == 0x09 || cp == 0x0A || cp == 0x0D || cp == 0x20);
245      return Character.isWhitespace(cp);
246   }
247
248   @Override /* ParserSession */
249   protected <T> T doParse(ParserPipe pipe, ClassMeta<T> type) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
250      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
251         if (r == null)
252            return null;
253         T o = parseAnything(type, r, getOuter(), null);
254         validateEnd(r);
255         return o;
256      }
257   }
258
259   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
260   protected <K,V> Map<K,V> doParseIntoMap(ParserPipe pipe, Map<K,V> m, Type keyType, Type valueType) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
261      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
262         m = parseIntoMap2(r, m, (ClassMeta<K>)getClassMeta(keyType), (ClassMeta<V>)getClassMeta(valueType), null);
263         validateEnd(r);
264         return m;
265      }
266   }
267
268   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
269   protected <E> Collection<E> doParseIntoCollection(ParserPipe pipe, Collection<E> c, Type elementType) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
270      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
271         c = parseIntoCollection2(r, c, getClassMeta(elementType), null);
272         validateEnd(r);
273         return c;
274      }
275   }
276
277   private <T> T parseAnything(ClassMeta<?> eType, ParserReader r, Object outer, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
278
279      if (eType == null)
280         eType = object();
281      ObjectSwap<T,Object> swap = (ObjectSwap<T,Object>)eType.getSwap(this);
282      BuilderSwap<T,Object> builder = (BuilderSwap<T,Object>)eType.getBuilderSwap(this);
283      ClassMeta<?> sType = null;
284      if (builder != null)
285         sType = builder.getBuilderClassMeta(this);
286      else if (swap != null)
287         sType = swap.getSwapClassMeta(this);
288      else
289         sType = eType;
290
291      if (sType.isOptional())
292         return (T)Utils.opt(parseAnything(eType.getElementType(), r, outer, pMeta));
293
294      setCurrentClass(sType);
295      String wrapperAttr = getJsonClassMeta(sType).getWrapperAttr();
296
297      Object o = null;
298
299      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
300      if (wrapperAttr != null)
301         skipWrapperAttrStart(r, wrapperAttr);
302      int c = r.peek();
303      if (c == -1) {
304         if (isStrict())
305            throw new ParseException(this, "Empty input.");
306         // Let o be null.
307      } else if ((c == ',' || c == '}' || c == ']')) {
308         if (isStrict())
309            throw new ParseException(this, "Missing value detected.");
310         // Handle bug in Cognos 10.2.1 that can product non-existent values.
311         // Let o be null;
312      } else if (c == 'n') {
313         parseKeyword("null", r);
314      } else if (sType.isObject()) {
315         if (c == '{') {
316            JsonMap m2 = new JsonMap(this);
317            parseIntoMap2(r, m2, string(), object(), pMeta);
318            o = cast(m2, pMeta, eType);
319         } else if (c == '[') {
320            o = parseIntoCollection2(r, new JsonList(this), object(), pMeta);
321         } else if (c == '\'' || c == '"') {
322            o = parseString(r);
323            if (sType.isChar())
324               o = parseCharacter(o);
325         } else if (c >= '0' && c <= '9' || c == '-' || c == '.') {
326            o = parseNumber(r, null);
327         } else if (c == 't') {
328            parseKeyword("true", r);
329            o = Boolean.TRUE;
330         } else {
331            parseKeyword("false", r);
332            o = Boolean.FALSE;
333         }
334      } else if (sType.isBoolean()) {
335         o = parseBoolean(r);
336      } else if (sType.isCharSequence()) {
337         o = parseString(r);
338      } else if (sType.isChar()) {
339         o = parseCharacter(parseString(r));
340      } else if (sType.isNumber()) {
341         o = parseNumber(r, (Class<? extends Number>)sType.getInnerClass());
342      } else if (sType.isMap()) {
343         Map m = (sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Map)sType.newInstance(outer) : newGenericMap(sType));
344         o = parseIntoMap2(r, m, sType.getKeyType(), sType.getValueType(), pMeta);
345      } else if (sType.isCollection()) {
346         if (c == '{') {
347            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
348            parseIntoMap2(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
349            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
350         } else {
351            Collection l = (sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Collection)sType.newInstance() : new JsonList(this));
352            o = parseIntoCollection2(r, l, sType, pMeta);
353         }
354      } else if (builder != null) {
355         BeanMap m = toBeanMap(builder.create(this, eType));
356         o = builder.build(this, parseIntoBeanMap2(r, m).getBean(), eType);
357      } else if (sType.canCreateNewBean(outer)) {
358         BeanMap m = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass());
359         o = parseIntoBeanMap2(r, m).getBean();
360      } else if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer) && (c == '\'' || c == '"')) {
361         o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, parseString(r));
362      } else if (sType.isArray() || sType.isArgs()) {
363         if (c == '{') {
364            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
365            parseIntoMap2(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
366            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
367         } else {
368            ArrayList l = (ArrayList)parseIntoCollection2(r, list(), sType, pMeta);
369            o = toArray(sType, l);
370         }
371      } else if (c == '{') {
372         Map m = new JsonMap(this);
373         parseIntoMap2(r, m, sType.getKeyType(), sType.getValueType(), pMeta);
374         if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(eType)))
375            o = cast((JsonMap)m, pMeta, eType);
376         else if (sType.getProxyInvocationHandler() != null)
377            o = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass()).load(m).getBean();
378         else
379            throw new ParseException(this, "Class ''{0}'' could not be instantiated.  Reason: ''{1}''",
380                  sType.getInnerClass().getName(), sType.getNotABeanReason());
381      } else if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer) && ! isStrict()) {
382         o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, parseString(r));
383      } else {
384         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax for class type ''{0}'', starting character ''{1}''",
385            sType, (char)c);
386      }
387
388      if (wrapperAttr != null)
389         skipWrapperAttrEnd(r);
390
391      if (swap != null && o != null)
392         o = unswap(swap, o, eType);
393
394      if (outer != null)
395         setParent(eType, o, outer);
396
397      return (T)o;
398   }
399
400   private Number parseNumber(ParserReader r, Class<? extends Number> type) throws IOException, ParseException {
401      int c = r.peek();
402      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
403         return parseNumber(r, parseString(r), type);
404      return parseNumber(r, r.parseNumberString(), type);
405   }
406
407   private Number parseNumber(ParserReader r, String s, Class<? extends Number> type) throws ParseException {
408
409      // JSON has slightly different number rules from Java.
410      // Strict mode enforces these different rules, lax does not.
411      if (isStrict()) {
412
413         // Lax allows blank strings to represent 0.
414         // Strict does not allow blank strings.
415         if (s.isEmpty())
416            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
417
418         // Need to weed out octal and hexadecimal formats:  0123,-0123,0x123,-0x123.
419         // Don't weed out 0 or -0.
420         boolean isNegative = false;
421         char c = s.charAt(0);
422         if (c == '-') {
423            isNegative = true;
424            c = (s.length() == 1 ? 'x' : s.charAt(1));
425         }
426
427         // JSON doesn't allow '.123' and '-.123'.
428         if (c == '.')
429            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
430
431         // '01' is not a valid number, but '0.1', '0e1', '0e+1' are valid.
432         if (c == '0' && s.length() > (isNegative ? 2 : 1)) {
433            char c2 = s.charAt((isNegative ? 2 : 1));
434            if (c2 != '.' && c2 != 'e' && c2 != 'E')
435               throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
436         }
437
438         // JSON doesn't allow '1.' or '0.e1'.
439         int i = s.indexOf('.');
440         if (i != -1 && (s.length() == (i+1) || ! decChars.contains(s.charAt(i+1))))
441            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
442
443      }
444      return StringUtils.parseNumber(s, type);
445   }
446
447   private Boolean parseBoolean(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
448      int c = r.peek();
449      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
450         return Boolean.valueOf(parseString(r));
451      if (c == 't') {
452         parseKeyword("true", r);
453         return Boolean.TRUE;
454      } else if (c == 'f') {
455         parseKeyword("false", r);
456         return Boolean.FALSE;
457      } else {
458         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected boolean value, actual=''{0}''", r.read(100));
459      }
460   }
461
462   private <K,V> Map<K,V> parseIntoMap2(ParserReader r, Map<K,V> m, ClassMeta<K> keyType,
463         ClassMeta<V> valueType, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
464
465      if (keyType == null)
466         keyType = (ClassMeta<K>)string();
467
468      int S0=0; // Looking for outer {
469      int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
470      int S3=3; // Found attrName end, looking for :.
471      int S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
472      int S5=5; // Looking for , or }
473      int S6=6; // Found , looking for attr start.
474
475      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
476      int state = S0;
477      String currAttr = null;
478      int c = 0;
479      while (c != -1) {
480         c = r.read();
481         if (state == S0) {
482            if (c == '{')
483               state = S1;
484            else
485               break;
486         } else if (state == S1) {
487            if (c == '}') {
488               return m;
489            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
490               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
491            } else {
492               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
493               state = S3;
494            }
495         } else if (state == S3) {
496            if (c == ':')
497               state = S4;
498         } else if (state == S4) {
499            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
500               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
501            } else {
502               K key = convertAttrToType(m, currAttr, keyType);
503               V value = parseAnything(valueType, r.unread(), m, pMeta);
504               setName(valueType, value, key);
505               m.put(key, value);
506               state = S5;
507            }
508         } else if (state == S5) {
509            if (c == ',') {
510               state = S6;
511            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
512               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
513            } else if (c == '}') {
514               return m;
515            } else {
516               break;
517            }
518         } else if (state == S6) {
519            if (c == '}') {
520               break;
521            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
522               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
523            } else {
524               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
525               state = S3;
526            }
527         }
528      }
529      if (state == S0)
530         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
531      if (state == S1)
532         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
533      if (state == S3)
534         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
535      if (state == S4)
536         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
537      if (state == S5)
538         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' marking end of JSON object.");
539      if (state == S6)
540         throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected '}' found in JSON object.");
541
542      return null; // Unreachable.
543   }
544
545   /*
546    * Parse a JSON attribute from the character array at the specified position, then
547    * set the position marker to the last character in the field name.
548    */
549   private String parseFieldName(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
550      int c = r.peek();
551      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
552         return parseString(r);
553      if (isStrict())
554         throw new ParseException(this, "Unquoted attribute detected.");
555      if (! VALID_BARE_CHARS.contains(c))
556         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find the start of the field name.");
557      r.mark();
558      // Look for whitespace.
559      while (c != -1) {
560         c = r.read();
561         if (! VALID_BARE_CHARS.contains(c)) {
562            r.unread();
563            String s = r.getMarked().intern();
564            return s.equals("null") ? null : s;
565         }
566      }
567      throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find the end of the field name.");
568   }
569
570   private static final AsciiSet VALID_BARE_CHARS = AsciiSet.create().range('A','Z').range('a','z').range('0','9').chars("$_-.").build();
571
572   private <E> Collection<E> parseIntoCollection2(ParserReader r, Collection<E> l,
573         ClassMeta<?> type, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
574
575      final int
576         S0=0, // Looking for outermost [
577         S1=1, // Looking for starting [ or { or " or ' or LITERAL or ]
578         S2=2, // Looking for , or ]
579         S3=3; // Looking for starting [ or { or " or ' or LITERAL
580
581      int argIndex = 0;
582
583      int state = S0;
584      int c = 0;
585      while (c != -1) {
586         c = r.read();
587         if (state == S0) {
588            if (c == '[')
589               state = S1;
590            else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c))
591               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
592            else
593               break;  // Invalid character found.
594         } else if (state == S1) {
595            if (c == ']') {
596               return l;
597            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
598               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
599            } else if (c != -1) {
600               l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(), r.unread(), l, pMeta));
601               state = S2;
602            }
603         } else if (state == S2) {
604            if (c == ',') {
605               state = S3;
606            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
607               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
608            } else if (c == ']') {
609               return l;
610            } else {
611               break;  // Invalid character found.
612            }
613         } else if (state == S3) {
614            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
615               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
616            } else if (c == ']') {
617               break;
618            } else if (c != -1) {
619               l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(), r.unread(), l, pMeta));
620               state = S2;
621            }
622         }
623      }
624      if (state == S0)
625         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '[' at beginning of JSON array.");
626      if (state == S1)
627         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
628      if (state == S2)
629         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected ',' or ']'.");
630      if (state == S3)
631         throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected trailing comma in array.");
632
633      return null;  // Unreachable.
634   }
635
636   private <T> BeanMap<T> parseIntoBeanMap2(ParserReader r, BeanMap<T> m) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
637
638      int S0=0; // Looking for outer {
639      int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
640      int S3=3; // Found attrName end, looking for :.
641      int S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
642      int S5=5; // Looking for , or }
643
644      int state = S0;
645      String currAttr = "";
646      int c = 0;
647      mark();
648      try {
649         while (c != -1) {
650            c = r.read();
651            if (state == S0) {
652               if (c == '{') {
653                  state = S1;
654               } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
655                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
656               } else {
657                  break;
658               }
659            } else if (state == S1) {
660               if (c == '}') {
661                  return m;
662               } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
663                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
664               } else {
665                  r.unread();
666                  mark();
667                  currAttr = parseFieldName(r);
668                  state = S3;
669               }
670            } else if (state == S3) {
671               if (c == ':')
672                  state = S4;
673            } else if (state == S4) {
674               if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
675                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
676               } else {
677                  if (! currAttr.equals(getBeanTypePropertyName(m.getClassMeta()))) {
678                     BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = m.getPropertyMeta(currAttr);
679                     setCurrentProperty(pMeta);
680                     if (pMeta == null) {
681                        onUnknownProperty(currAttr, m, parseAnything(object(), r.unread(), m.getBean(false), null));
682                        unmark();
683                     } else {
684                        unmark();
685                        ClassMeta<?> cm = pMeta.getClassMeta();
686                        Object value = parseAnything(cm, r.unread(), m.getBean(false), pMeta);
687                        setName(cm, value, currAttr);
688                        try {
689                           pMeta.set(m, currAttr, value);
690                        } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
691                           onBeanSetterException(pMeta, e);
692                           throw e;
693                        }
694                     }
695                     setCurrentProperty(null);
696                  }
697                  state = S5;
698               }
699            } else if (state == S5) {
700               if (c == ',')
701                  state = S1;
702               else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c))
703                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
704               else if (c == '}') {
705                  return m;
706               }
707            }
708         }
709         if (state == S0)
710            throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
711         if (state == S1)
712            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
713         if (state == S3)
714            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
715         if (state == S4)
716            throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
717         if (state == S5)
718            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' marking end of JSON object.");
719      } finally {
720         unmark();
721      }
722
723      return null; // Unreachable.
724   }
725
726   /*
727    * Starting from the specified position in the character array, returns the
728    * position of the character " or '.
729    * If the string consists of a concatenation of strings (e.g. 'AAA' + "BBB"), this method
730    * will automatically concatenate the strings and return the result.
731    */
732   private String parseString(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
733      r.mark();
734      int qc = r.read();      // The quote character being used (" or ')
735      if (qc != '"' && isStrict()) {
736         String msg = (
737            qc == '\''
738            ? "Invalid quote character \"{0}\" being used."
739            : "Did not find quote character marking beginning of string.  Character=\"{0}\""
740         );
741         throw new ParseException(this, msg, (char)qc);
742      }
743      final boolean isQuoted = (qc == '\'' || qc == '"');
744      String s = null;
745      boolean isInEscape = false;
746      int c = 0;
747      while (c != -1) {
748         c = r.read();
749         // Strict syntax requires that all control characters be escaped.
750         if (isStrict() && c <= 0x1F)
751            throw new ParseException(this, "Unescaped control character encountered: ''0x{0}''", String.format("%04X", c));
752         if (isInEscape) {
753            switch (c) {
754               case 'n': r.replace('\n'); break;
755               case 'r': r.replace('\r'); break;
756               case 't': r.replace('\t'); break;
757               case 'f': r.replace('\f'); break;
758               case 'b': r.replace('\b'); break;
759               case '\\': r.replace('\\'); break;
760               case '/': r.replace('/'); break;
761               case '\'': r.replace('\''); break;
762               case '"': r.replace('"'); break;
763               case 'u': {
764                  String n = r.read(4);
765                  try {
766                     r.replace(Integer.parseInt(n, 16), 6);
767                  } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
768                     throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid Unicode escape sequence in string.");
769                  }
770                  break;
771               }
772               default:
773                  throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid escape sequence in string.");
774            }
775            isInEscape = false;
776         } else {
777            if (c == '\\') {
778               isInEscape = true;
779               r.delete();
780            } else if (isQuoted) {
781               if (c == qc) {
782                  s = r.getMarked(1, -1);
783                  break;
784               }
785            } else {
786               if (c == ',' || c == '}' || c == ']' || isWhitespace(c)) {
787                  s = r.getMarked(0, -1);
788                  r.unread();
789                  break;
790               } else if (c == -1) {
791                  s = r.getMarked(0, 0);
792                  break;
793               }
794            }
795         }
796      }
797      if (s == null)
798         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find expected end character ''{0}''.", (char)qc);
799
800      // Look for concatenated string (i.e. whitespace followed by +).
801      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
802      if (r.peek() == '+') {
803         if (isStrict())
804            throw new ParseException(this, "String concatenation detected.");
805         r.read();  // Skip past '+', NOSONAR - Intentional.
806         skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
807         s += parseString(r);
808      }
809      return trim(s); // End of input reached.
810   }
811
812   /*
813    * Looks for the keywords true, false, or null.
814    * Throws an exception if any of these keywords are not found at the specified position.
815    */
816   private void parseKeyword(String keyword, ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
817      try {
818         String s = r.read(keyword.length());
819         if (s.equals(keyword))
820            return;
821         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected=''{0}'', Actual=''{1}''", keyword, s);
822      } catch (IndexOutOfBoundsException e) {
823         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected=''{0}'', found end-of-file.", keyword);
824      }
825   }
826
827   /*
828    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond any whitespace or comments.
829    * If positionOnNext is 'true', then the cursor will be set to the point immediately after
830    * the comments and whitespace.  Otherwise, the cursor will be set to the last position of
831    * the comments and whitespace.
832    */
833   private void skipCommentsAndSpace(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
834      int c = 0;
835      while ((c = r.read()) != -1) {
836         if (! isWhitespace(c)) {
837            if (c == '/') {
838               if (isStrict())
839                  throw new ParseException(this, "Javascript comment detected.");
840               skipComments(r);
841            } else {
842               r.unread();
843               return;
844            }
845         }
846      }
847   }
848
849   /*
850    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond the construct "{wrapperAttr:" when
851    * the @Json(wrapperAttr) annotation is used on a class.
852    */
853   private void skipWrapperAttrStart(ParserReader r, String wrapperAttr) throws IOException, ParseException {
854
855      final int
856         S0=0, // Looking for outer '{'
857         S1=1, // Looking for attrName start.
858         S3=3, // Found attrName end, looking for :.
859         S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
860
861      int state = S0;
862      String currAttr = null;
863      int c = 0;
864      while (c != -1) {
865         c = r.read();
866         if (state == S0) {
867            if (c == '{')
868               state = S1;
869         } else if (state == S1) {
870            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
871               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
872            } else {
873               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
874               if (! currAttr.equals(wrapperAttr))
875                  throw new ParseException(this,
876                     "Expected to find wrapper attribute ''{0}'' but found attribute ''{1}''", wrapperAttr, currAttr);
877               state = S3;
878            }
879         } else if (state == S3) {
880            if (c == ':')
881               state = S4;
882         } else if (state == S4) {
883            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
884               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
885            } else {
886               r.unread();
887               return;
888            }
889         }
890      }
891      if (state == S0)
892         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
893      if (state == S1)
894         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
895      if (state == S3)
896         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
897      if (state == S4)
898         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
899   }
900
901   /*
902    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond the construct "}" when
903    * the @Json(wrapperAttr) annotation is used on a class.
904    */
905   private void skipWrapperAttrEnd(ParserReader r) throws ParseException, IOException {
906      int c = 0;
907      while ((c = r.read()) != -1) {
908         if (! isWhitespace(c)) {
909            if (c == '/') {
910               if (isStrict())
911                  throw new ParseException(this, "Javascript comment detected.");
912               skipComments(r);
913            } else if (c == '}') {
914               return;
915            } else {
916               throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' at the end of JSON wrapper object.");
917            }
918         }
919      }
920   }
921
922   /*
923    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but when positioned at the beginning of comment,
924    * it will move the pointer to the last character in the comment.
925    */
926   private void skipComments(ParserReader r) throws ParseException, IOException {
927      int c = r.read();
928      //  "/* */" style comments
929      if (c == '*') {
930         while (c != -1)
931            if ((c = r.read()) == '*')
932               if ((c = r.read()) == '/')
933                  return;
934      //  "//" style comments
935      } else if (c == '/') {
936         while (c != -1) {
937            c = r.read();
938            if (c == -1 || c == '\n')
939               return;
940         }
941      }
942      throw new ParseException(this, "Open ended comment.");
943   }
944
945   /*
946    * Call this method after you've finished a parsing a string to make sure that if there's any
947    * remainder in the input, that it consists only of whitespace and comments.
948    */
949   private void validateEnd(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
950      if (! isValidateEnd())
951         return;
952      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
953      int c = r.read();
954      if (c != -1 && c != ';')  // var x = {...}; expressions can end with a semicolon.
955         throw new ParseException(this, "Remainder after parse: ''{0}''.", (char)c);
956   }
957
958   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
959   // Properties
960   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
961
962   /**
963    * Validate end.
964    *
965    * @see JsonParser.Builder#validateEnd()
966    * @return
967    *    <jk>true</jk> if after parsing a POJO from the input, verifies that the remaining input in
968    *    the stream consists of only comments or whitespace.
969    */
970   protected boolean isValidateEnd() {
971      return ctx.isValidateEnd();
972   }
973
974   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
975   // Extended metadata
976   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
977
978   /**
979    * Returns the language-specific metadata on the specified class.
980    *
981    * @param cm The class to return the metadata on.
982    * @return The metadata.
983    */
984   protected JsonClassMeta getJsonClassMeta(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
985      return ctx.getJsonClassMeta(cm);
986   }
987}
